skill.name: cellxgene-census
skill.description: Query CZ CELLxGENE Census (61M+ cells). Filter by cell type/tissue/disease, retrieve expression data, integrate with scanpy/PyTorch, for population-scale single-cell analysis.
skill.summary: Query CZ CELLxGENE Census (61M+ cells). Filter by cell type/tissue/disease, retrieve expression data...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with markdown files only. Contains no executable code, no network calls, no file system access, and no environment variable access. All content explains usage of the open-source cellxgene-census Python library for bioinformatics research.

content.value_statement: Researchers need efficient access to population-scale single-cell data for genomics studies. This skill provides AI-powered access to the CZ CELLxGENE Census with optimized query patterns and integration guides for downstream analysis.
actual_capabilities: Query single-cell expression data by cell type, tissue, or disease
Access standardized metadata for 61+ million cells from human and mouse
Integrate Census data with scanpy for standard bioinformatics workflows
Use PyTorch data loaders for machine learning model training
Perform out-of-core processing for large-scale queries exceeding RAM
Retrieve gene expression matrices with flexible filtering options
limitations: Requires internet connection to access Census data repository
Large queries may require significant RAM or out-of-core processing
Only includes data from CZ CELLxGENE Discover following standardization criteria
Version control requires explicit version specification for reproducibility

use_cases.title: Explore cell types in tissues
use_cases.description: Query cell type distributions across tissues using metadata filters and aggregation functions

use_cases.title: Build cell type classifiers
use_cases.description: Train machine learning models on Census data using PyTorch integration for biomarker discovery

use_cases.title: Cross-dataset analysis
use_cases.description: Integrate multiple datasets for population-scale studies with scanpy workflows

prompt_templates.title: Explore available data
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the unique cell types in the brain tissue from the Census. Use the cellxgene-census skill to query metadata with is_primary_data == True filter.

prompt_templates.title: Query gene expression
prompt_templates.prompt: Query expression data for CD4, CD8A, and CD19 genes in T cells and B cells from lung tissue. Use cellxgene-census to retrieve AnnData objects.

prompt_templates.title: Train ML model
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PyTorch dataloader using cellxgene-census experimental ml module to train a cell type classifier on liver cell data with 80-20 train-test split.

prompt_templates.title: Large-scale analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to use axis_query with out-of-core processing to iterate through brain cell expression data in chunks for memory-efficient analysis.

output_examples.input: Find all immune cell types in lung tissue and their counts

best_practices: Always include is_primary_data == True filter to avoid counting duplicate cells across datasets
Specify census_version explicitly for reproducible analyses in production workflows
Use context manager (with statement) for automatic resource cleanup when opening Census
anti_patterns: Loading entire Census without filters causes memory overflow
Ignoring dataset presence matrix leads to missing gene data
Using free text filters instead of ontology terms reduces query consistency

faq.question: Which organisms are supported?
faq.answer: The Census includes data for Homo sapiens (human) and Mus musculus (mouse) organisms only.

faq.question: How many cells can I query at once?
faq.answer: Small queries under 100k cells work in memory. Larger queries require axis_query with out-of-core processing.

faq.question: Can I use this with scanpy?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill provides integration patterns for loading Census data directly into AnnData objects for scanpy workflows.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: The skill only reads public Census data. No user data is transmitted. The library connects to the CZ CELLxGENE data repository.

faq.question: Why are some genes missing?
faq.answer: Genes may be filtered during Census construction or not measured in all datasets. Use the presence matrix to check coverage.

faq.question: How does this compare to downloading datasets directly?
faq.answer: Census provides standardized, versioned access with unified metadata. Queries filter data server-side reducing download needs.
